ccSpeciesAndLandingsGuidanceListItem1: A landing date is required before selecting a vessel
ccSpeciesAndLandingsGuidanceListItem2: Landing dates can be up to {{landingLimitDaysInTheFuture}} days in the future in draft documents but only up to 3 days in the future in final submitted catch certificates
ccSpeciesAndLandingsGuidanceListItem3: All landings should have been made in accordance with the relevant conservation and management measures
ccAddLandingDateLandedHelpSection: The date landed is the date the vessel finishes its fishing trip and unloads its catch at port.
ccAddLandingDateLandedHelpSectionHeader1: You can enter a landing date:
ccAddLandingDateLandedHelpSectionGuidanc: up to 7 days in the future in draft documents
up to 3 days in the future in final submitted catch certificates
multiple landings can take up to 30 minutes to validate
a maximum of 100 landings is allowed per certificate
ccAddLandingVesselNameLabel: Vessel name or port letter and number (PLN)
ccAddLandingVesselNameHint: You must add a date before selecting a vessel
ccAddLandingHelpSectionContent: If the vessel you need is not listed, select "Vessel not listed – select if not available (N/A)" from the dropdown.
ccAddLandingHelpSectionContent2: This option is for cases where the vessel is not in the system or cannot be found using the search.
ccAddVesselFormVesselQueryPrompt: Type at least 2 characters to load list
ccAddVesselFormVesselDateQueryPrompt: Enter a valid date landed to enable Vessel name
ccAddLandingGearDetailsHint: The type of gear used to catch the fish
ccAddLandingGearDetailsHelpSectionConten: Gear categories describe the general method used to catch fish, such as trawls or nets.
Gear types are more specific, like "Beam trawls" or "Set gillnets".
Select the most accurate option based on how the fish were caught. If you're unsure, contact your suppliers or fisheries authority.
Find out more about Gear information (opens in new tab)
ccAddLandingHSAHint: Select yes if the product was caught in international waters
ccAddLandingHSAGuidanceLabel: What is a high seas area?
ccAddLandingHSAGuidanceDesc1Content: High Seas Area - high seas are international marine waters outside the jurisdiction of any country beyond the 200nm limit of the EEZ.
ccAddLandingHSAGuidanceDesc2Link: Find out more about High Seas areas (opens in new tab).
ccRfmoHintText: The organisation responsible for managing fishing in the area where the fish were caught
ccRfmoHelpSectionLinkText: What is a regional fisheries management organisation (RFMO)?
ccRfmoHelpSectionContentOne: Regional Fisheries Management Organisations (RFMO) - RFMOs are international organisations establishing binding measures for conservation and sustainable management of highly migratory or straddling fish species.
ccRfmoHelpSectionContentTwoLink: Find out more about RFMOs (opens in new tab).
